# Security policy

## Supported versions

Security updates are provided for the **latest release** of the package.
We recommend staying on the current version to receive fixes.

## Reporting a vulnerability

**Please do not open a public issue for security vulnerabilities.**

To report a vulnerability:

1. **Preferred:** [Create a private security advisory](https://github.com/aseguragonzalez/php-seedwork/security/advisories/new)
   on GitHub. This keeps the report confidential until a fix is ready.
2. **Alternative:** Email the maintainer at
   [a.segura.gonzalez@gmail.com](mailto:a.segura.gonzalez@gmail.com) with a description of the issue.

### What to include

- Affected component or part of the library (if known)
- Package version (e.g. from `composer show aseguragonzalez/php-seedwork`)
- Steps to reproduce
- Impact (what an attacker could do)

### Response

We will acknowledge your report within a few days and will work on a fix for supported versions.
We will keep you updated and will credit you in the advisory and release notes unless you prefer to stay anonymous.

## Acknowledgments

We thank everyone who reports security issues responsibly. Your efforts help keep the package safe for all users.
